Mehanna delivers defiant statement at sentencing

Tarek Mehanna of Sudbury, convicted in December of supporting Al Qaeda, told a federal court today of his love of Islam and his anger at US wars. (Globe, 12:07 p.m.)

Hazing hits headlines when somebody dies trying to fulfill an initiation rite, or when police happen upon humiliated hopefuls in Allston, but it’s everywhere.

Inspired by a dog they adopted, a Boston couple opened a bakery for dogs, and for six weeks starting in May, all Target stores nationwide will carry their treats.

Dharam Jain’s convenience store will stay open after an overnight blitz of volunteers helped him revamp the store’s layout to improve safety.

to unwed parents

after UN truce deadline
